intro: Distephanus trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined distephanus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
